Remarks.
Hydroides trivesiculosa
can usually be distinguished from
H. albiceps
by the exceptionally large size of the dorsal bulbous verticil spine, and the lower number of verticil spines, but there are (few) transitional forms. Additionally, molecular studies are needed to determine whether
H. trivesiculosa
and
H. albiceps
are separate species.
Distribution. Qld, tropical Australia , Tanzania , Red Sea, Seychelles , Indonesia .
